document.docOrigin: Papéis Avulsos de Zoologia (Pap. Avulsos Zool., S. Paulo) 60 (34)
document.masterDocTitle: A contribution to the genera Plectonotum Gorham and Hyponotum Wittmer, with the description of sixteen new species from Peru (Coleoptera, Cantharidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A contribution to the genera Plectonotum Gorham and Hyponotum Wittmer, with the description of sixteen new species from Peru (Coleoptera, Cantharidae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to the South American species of
Hyponotum

keyLead.emphasis: 1. Head and pronotum dull,coarsely punctate.Lateral edges of pronotum with a short bead on the anterior part...................................................................... 2
— Head and pronotum thinly punctate,the punctations considerably narrower than the intervals.Pronotum without noticeable bead..................................... 4

3. Head narrowly dark spotted on the vertex or entirely red, pronotum red................................................................................................
H.penai Wittmer,1980
4. Length over 6.0 mm. Pronotum yellow with black marks;anterior edge arcuate,lateral edges without visible bead on the front corners............................... 5

emphasis.keyLead: — Length under 5.5 mm . Pronotum red or black;distinct front angle,the front margin and the lateral margins separate,usually with a vestigial bead............. 9

5. Pronotum orange red with a small transverse median brown patch on the disc, and two brown patches on the sides,strongly punctate, the punctations as wide as their intervals. Chile ............................................................................................................................................................
H.trisignatum ( Pic,1926 )
— Pronotum yellow with a median light-brown line and,usually,a wide lateral black border ..................................................................................................... 6

6. Males:antennomeres III-IV broader than long. Elytra thinly,not seriately punctate. Argentina ................................................
H.simplicicorne ( Wittmer,1951 )

7. Males:antennomere III with subparallel sides,four times longer than broad. Chile ..............................................................................
H.grandicolle (Pic,1928)

8. Elytral punctation strong,subseriately disposed,the margins not upturned.Males:antennomere IV 1.2 times longer than III. Chile ...
H. chilense Wittmer,1957

10. Head, pronotum and elytra testaceous yellow. Head and pronotum surface smooth. Lateral margins of pronotum wide, explanate and slightly upturned. Chile ...............................................................................................................................................................................................
H.flavulum Wittmer,1980

— Length 3.0- 3.5 mm .Males:antennomere IV 2 times longer than III.Elytra with suture and lateral margins paler than disc. Chile ....
H.liliputanum Wittmer 1950

14. Elytra yellow. Head bicolorous, black behind, yellow in front of the eyes. Pronotum yellow with a wide discal black patch. Head and pronotum strongly punctate,their intervals slightly alutaceous.Elytral punctations disposed in irregular rows. Chile ........................................
H.unifoveolatum Wittmer,1980

16. Pronotum red with two wide black patches on the anterior angles. Chile ...............................................................................................
H.collare (Solier,1849)

18. Head as wide as pronotum.Elytra with coarse punctation ( Figs.21 , 44 ). Peru ...................................................................................
H.macrocephalum
sp.nov.

19. Elytra violet blue.Males:antennomeres IV-VII with emarginate posterior-ventral edge.Head and pronotum smooth. Argentina ..
H. violaceipenne (Pic,1928)
